info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 30 at 11:51PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM EDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of western North Carolina, including the following county, Burke. * WHEN...Until 200 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1151 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hickory, Morganton, Longview, Valdese, Gamewell, Salem, Icard, Drexel, Hildebran, Connelly Springs, Rutherford College, Glen Alpine, Rhodhiss, Table Rock, South Mountains State Park, Lake James State Park, Lake Rhodhiss, Lake James, Hickory Regional Airport and Linville Falls. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
